intro: Bryonia grandis, commonly known as the giant bryony, is a climbing plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant produces large, heart-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a thick, spiny capsule that contains toxic seeds. Due to its poisonous nature, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
